critique: The document pertains to an executive order amending a previous order regarding appointments during a national defense program. It allows the Civil Service Commission to authorize filling positions without competitive requirements, subject to noncompetitive fitness tests. This could be seen as a moderate expansion of executive power in times of national exigency. The order does not directly address immigration, federalism, civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It has a slight conservative tilt due to its focus on national defense and potential circumvention of standard civil service procedures.
